summary: The Farm and Food Cybersecurity Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Agriculture to assess cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities in the agriculture and food critical infrastructure sector every two years, providing recommendations to enhance security and resilience. It also mandates an annual cross-sector simulation exercise relating to a food-related emergency or disruption over a five-year period. The bill defines key terms, requires private sector consultation, and mandates reports to Congress on assessments and exercises, including lessons learned and recommendations.
